persona.name: Carlos
persona.activities: Carlos works at the European Commission as regulator. He works together with various companies on usable and efficient privacy solutions for citizens.
persona.attitudes: He is a strong believer in privacy. He knows the field very well: Carlos is up-to-date with various research activities and solutions. He knows that privacy is complex and he sometimes feels he has to surrender from the enormous amount of privacy-related projects which are not brought to solutions. He is disappointed from the fact that there is no usable solution on the market yet.
persona.motivations: Privacy is Carlos' driver. He strongly follows his goal which is to provide solutions for European citizens which effectively protect the privacy of the citizens. He knows that this is challenging but this challenge motivates him.

document_reference.excerpt: Members of the European commission are interested in protecting the rights of their citizens when it comes to privacy and security. Carlos at the commission is responsible for helping people realise and protect their right to privacy.

document_reference.name: Is privacy-aware
document_reference.document: Manageable privacy policies across the application lifecycle User Story
document_reference.excerpt:
This is a concern and on behalf of the commission, he sets about finding a solution before sensors become commonly deployed (with privacy becoming an afterthought).

He likes Webinos because he sees that Webinos can provide a solution for privacy across platforms both current and future. 

He wants to work collaboratively with vendors to implement privacy policies that empower and protect EU citizens.

Carlos also sees that many of the new privacy initiatives that the EU wants to implement, especially for sensor based networks, may be implemented After deployment.
